file_content.text: No. I sense his presence, but it is faint. Distant. You are not Tenebrae.
I am Lord Dramath. A thousand years ago, I ruled this planet, when it was a vibrant world named Medriaas.
Is there a point to your ramblings?
Stop the history lesson.
I know Tenebrae's weakness.
This holocron is not just my prison. It can destroy him once and for all.
Maybe I can turn the tables on Valkorion. Imprison him inside the holocron and harness his power.
I'd rather enslave him.
There will come a moment when Tenebrae is vulnerable. That is when you must strike.
You know things about Valkorion that could be useful. Maybe we should keep you around for a while.
I have given you the key to end my son's existence. There is no purpose to keeping me alive.
Lana's right. We need every available weapon to defeat Valkorion--including you.
I'm keeping you imprisoned.
No! Release me. I beg of you...
That explains Valkorion's behavior. He didn't want you snooping around in his vault.
Hold on to the holocron for now. Valkorion can't know we have it.
I've got a bad feeling about this...
Are you talking about Valkorion?
Tenebrae?
Valkorion. Tenebrae. Vitiate, Emperor of the Sith. My low-born son has worn many masks.
I never thought of Valkorion as having a father.
You called him your son.
One of many offspring I sired.
He was the least of my children; his mother, a nameless peasant. But he murdered me, imprisoned my spirit, and turned Medriaas into... this.
If you were a better father, things could have turned out differently.
Maybe you're to blame.
Do not lay his crimes at my feet.
He lured many Sith Lords here before consuming them in a dark ritual that wiped out all life on the planet.
He did something similar on Ziost.
His hunger for immortality must constantly be fed.
Why didn't he consume your spirit?
But he didn't feed on you.
For a thousand years, he has taunted and tortured me. But now salvation is at hand.
This holocron has the power to destroy what remains of my essence. Grant me the release of oblivion.
You'd better be offering something worth the trouble.
What's in it for me?
Valkorion has many victims, but none who have suffered for as long as you. I will set you free.
I will release you.
And so it ends...
I hope we don't regret that.
Valkorion wouldn't have sealed you in his vault unless he had a reason.
You must be important.
Valkorion despises me.
I'm guessing Valkorion had something to do with whatever destroyed this world.
And now it's a wasteland.
You said this was once a lush and vibrant world. What happened?
How did he destroy the planet?
Anything in Valkorion's past I can use to defeat him once and for all?
Maybe you can help me.
I don't trust Valkorion, but I don't trust you, either.
There must be a catch.
I can help you defeat Tenebrae. I know his weakness.
Are you sure? Just end it all?
Is that really what you want?
I seek an end to my suffering... and revenge against Tenebrae. Through you, I can have both.
Every time Valkorion gets taken down, he pops up again in some other form.
I've heard that before.
I've been waiting for this for a long time. What do I do?
How does it work?
He has taken steps to guard against capture. But this holocron is still the weapon he fears most.
He is immortal but not invulnerable. This holocron is the instrument of his destruction.
I thought I destroyed him when he was the Sith Emperor. Then I fought him on Ziost. Then I discovered he was Valkorion. He just keeps coming back.
He's not that easy to kill.
Is this some kind of datapad?
Who--or what--are you?
You look like an ancient Sith Lord... but I thought your spirits were bound to your tombs.
Are you a Force ghost?
It's the spirit of an ancient Sith Lord--though they are usually bound to their tombs.
I exist between life and death, imprisoned in this holocron by the one who lives within you.
I knew him as Tenebrae, but my low-born son has worn many masks. Vitiate, Emperor of the Sith. Valkorion. His name does not matter.
I've hunted enough spirits to know one when I see it.
You're a Sith spirit.
He is solely responsible for this atrocity.
Have you come to torment me again?
Until then, release me from my prison, keep the holocron close, and bide your time.
Are you some kind of recording?
Who--or what--are you?
